title: A Tale of Two Cities
content: Set during the French Revolution, this novel contrasts the lives of two men who look alike but have very different fates.

history.title: A Tale of Two Cities
history.content: It was the best of times, it was the worst of times...

history.title: A Tale of Two Cities
history.content: A far, far better thing that I do, than I have ever done...

title: All Quiet on the Western Front
content: A harrowing account of a German soldier's experiences and disillusionment during World War I.

history.title: All Quiet on the Western Front
history.content: We are forlorn like children, and experienced like old men...

history.title: All Quiet on the Western Front
history.content: I am young, I am twenty years old; yet I know nothing of life but despair...

history.title: All Quiet on the Western Front
history.content: A harrowing account of a German soldier's experiences and disillusionment during World War I.

title: Pride and Prejudice
content: It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife.

content: War is peace. Freedom is slavery. Ignorance is strength. These paradoxes define the dystopian society in which the characters find themselves trapped.

history.content: Big Brother is watching you...
In the end, the Party would announce that two and two made five...

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
content: You never really understand a person until you consider things from his point of view, until you climb into his skin and walk around in it.

history.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
history.content: Mockingbirds don’t do one thing but make music for us to enjoy...

history.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
history.content: The one thing that doesn’t abide by majority rule is a person’s conscience...

history.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
history.content: You never really understand a person until you consider things from his point of view, until you climb into his skin and walk around in it.

title: Moby-Dick
content: Call me Ishmael. Some years ago—never mind how long precisely—having little or no money in my purse, and nothing particular to interest me on shore, I thought I would sail about a little and see the watery part of the world.

history.title: Moby-Dick
history.content: Whenever I find myself growing grim about the mouth; whenever it is a damp, drizzly November in my soul...

history.title: Moby-Dick
history.content: It was the whiteness of the whale that above all things appalled me.

history.title: Moby-Dick
history.content: Call me Ishmael. Some years ago—never mind how long precisely—having little or no money in my purse, and nothing particular to interest me on shore, I thought I would sail about a little and see the watery part of the world.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
content: Don't ever tell anybody anything. If you do, you start missing everybody.

history.title: The Catcher in the Rye
history.content: If you really want to hear about it, the first thing you'll probably want to know is where I was born...

history.title: The Catcher in the Rye
history.content: The mark of the immature man is that he wants to die nobly for a cause, while the mark of the mature man is that he wants to live humbly for one.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
content: There is only one way to get rid of temptation, and that is to yield to it.

history.title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
history.content: Beauty is a form of genius—is higher, indeed, than genius, as it needs no explanation.

history.title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
history.content: There is only one thing in the world worse than being talked about, and that is not being talked about.

history.title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
history.content: There is only one way to get rid of temptation, and that is to yield to it.

title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
content: It's a good thing to have a noble master, but it's a better thing to be a noble man.

history.title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
history.content: Tom Sawyer was a boy of twelve then, a little small for his age, but the same old sweet song and dance.

history.title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
history.content: It's a mighty long way from the Mississippi to the Gulf of Mexico.
